member.name: T:MaterialForms.MultiSchema
member.summary: Allows adding multiple schemas within the same row.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MultiSchema.Schemas
member.summary: Gets the schemas being presented.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MultiSchema.RelativeColumnWidths
member.summary: Gets the star size width of each schema in their respective index. Default width for each element is one unit.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.DialogTheme
member.summary: Represents the color theme of the displayed dialog.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.DialogTheme.Inherit
member.summary: Inherits the scheme used by the application.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.DialogTheme.Light
member.summary: Light background with dark foreground color.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.DialogTheme.Dark
member.summary: Dark background with light foreground color.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.DefaultDialogTheme
member.summary: Represents the default theme used by new dialogs.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets the title that appears in the dialog. This is not the same as the window title.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.Message
member.summary: Gets or sets the message that appears in the dialog.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.PositiveAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that appears on the positive dialog button. A null or empty value hides the button.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.Theme
member.summary: Gets or sets the dialog theme.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.OnPositiveAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback that will be invoked when the positive button is clicked by the user. When this property is not null, the dialog must be closed explicitly using Session.Close(result).

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.NegativeAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that appears on the negative dialog button. A null or empty value hides the button.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.OnNegativeAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback that will be invoked when the negative button is clicked by the user. When this property is not null, the dialog must be closed explicitly using Session.Close(result).

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.AuxiliaryAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the text that appears on the auxiliary dialog button. A null or empty value hides the button.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.OnAuxiliaryAction
member.summary: Gets or sets the callback that will be invoked when the auxiliary button is clicked by the user.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.View
member.summary: Gets a new instance of a DialogView bound to this object.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.ValidatesOnPositiveAction
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to perform form validation before handling the positive dialog action.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialDialog.ShowsProgressOnPositiveAction
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to show a progress indicator while performing the positive dialog action. Applies only when a custom handler is assigned to the PositiveAction property.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.Session.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique ID associated with this session.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.Session.Dialog
member.summary: Gets the dialog object for which this session exists.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.Session.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the form schema with the specified key.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.Session.Task
member.summary: Gets the task that represents the dialog's session lifecycle.

member.name: M:MaterialForms.Session.Close(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Closes the session unconditionally.
member.param: The value that will be returned from the session's task.

member.name: M:MaterialForms.Session.Invalidate(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays an error message for the specified schema.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.WindowSession
member.summary: Manages the lifecycle of a window displayed to the user.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.WindowSession.DialogIdentifier
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for the window's dialog host.

member.name: E:MaterialForms.WindowSession.Loaded
member.summary: Occurs when the window has loaded and has been displayed to the user.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.WindowSession.Window
member.summary: Gets the data context of the displayed window.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.WindowSession.IsClosed
member.summary: Gets whether the session has finished and the window is closed.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.WindowSession.IsLoaded
member.summary: Gets whether the window has loaded and has been displayed to the user. A true value does not guarantee that the window is still open.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.WindowSession.Dialog
member.summary: Gets the dialog associated with the MaterialWindow context.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.WindowSession.Task
member.summary: Gets the task representing the window session being displayed. The task returns the window's dialog result.
member.remarks: Waiting synchronously for this task from the same dispatcher will cause a deadlock.

member.name: M:MaterialForms.WindowSession.Close(System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Closes the displayed window unconditionally.
member.param: The value that will be returned from the session's task.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Extensions.InitializerExtensions
member.summary: Helper extensions for object initialization.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.CanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could be null sometimes, so the check for null is necessary before its usage.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked element could never be null.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.ItemNotNullAttribute
member.summary: Can be appplied to symbols of types derived from IEnumerable as well as to symbols of Task and Lazy classes to indicate that the value of a collection item, of the Task.Result property or of the Lazy.Value property can never be null.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.ItemCanBeNullAttribute
member.summary: Can be appplied to symbols of types derived from IEnumerable as well as to symbols of Task and Lazy classes to indicate that the value of a collection item, of the Task.Result property or of the Lazy.Value property can be null.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method builds string by format pattern and (optional) arguments. Parameter, which contains format string, should be given in constructor. The format string should be in -like form.

member.name: M:MaterialForms.Annotations.StringFormatMethodAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.param: Specifies which parameter of an annotated method should be treated as format-string

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.ValueProviderAttribute
member.summary: For a parameter that is expected to be one of the limited set of values. Specify fields of which type should be used as values for this parameter.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.InvokerParameterNameAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the function argument should be string literal and match one of the parameters of the caller function. For example, ReSharper annotates the parameter of .

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.NotifyPropertyChangedInvocatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the method is contained in a type that implements System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged interface and this method is used to notify that some property value changed.
member.remarks:
The method should be non-static and conform to one of the supported signatures:
NotifyChanged(string)
NotifyChanged(params string[])
NotifyChanged{T}(Expression{Func{T}})
NotifyChanged{T,U}(Expression{Func{T,U}})
SetProperty{T}(ref T, T, string)

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.ContractAnnotationAttribute
member.summary: Describes dependency between method input and output.
member.syntax:
Function Definition Table syntax:
FDT ::= FDTRow [;FDTRow]*
FDTRow ::= Input => Output | Output <= Input
Input ::= ParameterName: Value [, Input]*
Output ::= [ParameterName: Value]* {halt|stop|void|nothing|Value}
Value ::= true | false | null | notnull | canbenull
If method has single input parameter, it's name could be omitted.
Using halt (or void/nothing, which is the same) for method output means that the methos doesn't return normally.
canbenull annotation is only applicable for output parameters.
You can use multiple [ContractAnnotation] for each FDT row, or use single attribute with rows separated by semicolon.

item.code: [ContractAnnotation("halt <= condition: false")] public void Assert(bool condition, string text) // regular assertion method
[ContractAnnotation("s:null => true")] public bool IsNullOrEmpty(string s) // string.IsNullOrEmpty()
[ContractAnnotation("s:null=>false; =>true,result:notnull; =>false, result:null")] public bool TryParse(string s, out Person result)

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.LocalizationRequiredAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that marked element should be localized or not.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.CannotApplyEqualityOperatorAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the value of the marked type (or its derivatives) cannot be compared using '==' or '!=' operators and Equals() should be used instead. However, using '==' or '!=' for comparison with null is always permitted.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.BaseTypeRequiredAttribute
member.summary: When applied to a target attribute, specifies a requirement for any type marked with the target attribute to implement or inherit specific type or types.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.UsedImplicitlyAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked symbol is used implicitly (e.g. via reflection, in external library), so this symbol will not be marked as unused (as well as by other usage inspections).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.MeansImplicitUseAttribute
member.summary: Should be used on attributes and causes ReSharper to not mark symbols marked with such attributes as unused (as well as by other usage inspections)

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Access
member.summary: Only entity marked with attribute considered used.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.Assign
member.summary: Indicates implicit assignment to a member.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedWithFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type with fixed constructor signature. That means any unused constructor parameters won't be reported as such.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.ImplicitUseKindFlags.InstantiatedNoFixedConstructorSignature
member.summary: Indicates implicit instantiation of a type.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags
member.summary: Specify what is considered used implicitly when marked with or .

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.Members
member.summary: Members of entity marked with attribute are considered used.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.ImplicitUseTargetFlags.WithMembers
member.summary: Entity marked with attribute and all its members considered used.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.PublicAPIAttribute
member.summary: This attribute is intended to mark publicly available API which should not be removed and so is treated as used.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.InstantHandleAttribute
member.summary: Tells code analysis engine if the parameter is completely handled when the invoked method is on stack. If the parameter is a delegate, indicates that delegate is executed while the method is executed. If the parameter is an enumerable, indicates that it is enumerated while the method is executed.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.PureAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a method does not make any observable state changes. The same as System.Diagnostics.Contracts.PureAttribute.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.MustUseReturnValueAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the return value of method invocation must be used.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.ProvidesContextAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the type member or parameter of some type, that should be used instead of all other ways to get the value that type. This annotation is useful when you have some "context" value evaluated and stored somewhere, meaning that all other ways to get this value must be consolidated with existing one.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.PathReferenceAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that a parameter is a path to a file or a folder within a web project. Path can be relative or absolute, starting from web root (~).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.SourceTemplateAttribute
member.summary: An extension method marked with this attribute is processed by ReSharper code completion as a 'Source Template'. When extension method is completed over some expression, it's source code is automatically expanded like a template at call site.
member.remarks: Template method body can contain valid source code and/or special comments starting with '$'. Text inside these comments is added as source code when the template is applied. Template parameters can be used either as additional method parameters or as identifiers wrapped in two '$' signs. Use the attribute to specify macros for parameters.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.MacroAttribute
member.summary: Allows specifying a macro for a parameter of a source template.
member.remarks: You can apply the attribute on the whole method or on any of its additional parameters. The macro expression is defined in the property. When applied on a method, the target template parameter is defined in the property. To apply the macro silently for the parameter, set the property value = -1.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.Annotations.MacroAttribute.Expression
member.summary: Allows specifying a macro that will be executed for a source template parameter when the template is expanded.

members.member:
Allows specifying which occurrence of the target parameter becomes editable when the template is deployed.
If the target parameter is used several times in the template, only one occurrence becomes editable; other occurrences are changed synchronously. To specify the zero-based index of the editable occurrence, use values >= 0. To make the parameter non-editable when the template is expanded, use -1. >

member.name: P:MaterialForms.Annotations.MacroAttribute.Target
member.summary: Identifies the target parameter of a source template if the is applied on a template method.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcActionAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC action. If applied to a method, the MVC action name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcAreaAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC area. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcControllerAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC controller. If applied to a method, the MVC controller name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.ChildActionExtensions.RenderAction(HtmlHelper, String, String).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcMasterAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC Master. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, String).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcModelTypeAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC model type. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(String, Object).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcPartialViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC partial view. If applied to a method, the MVC partial view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.RenderPartialExtensions.RenderPartial(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcSuppressViewErrorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Allows disabling inspections for MVC views within a class or a method.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcDisplayTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC display template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.DisplayExtensions.DisplayForModel(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcEditorTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC editor template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Html.EditorExtensions.EditorForModel(HtmlHelper, String).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcTemplateAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. Indicates that a parameter is an MVC template. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.ComponentModel.DataAnnotations.UIHintAttribute(System.String).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view component. If applied to a method, the MVC view name is calculated implicitly from the context. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.Mvc.Controller.View(Object).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcViewComponentAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view component name.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcViewComponentViewAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. If applied to a parameter, indicates that the parameter is an MVC view component view. If applied to a method, the MVC view component view name is default.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AspMvcActionSelectorAttribute
member.summary: ASP.NET MVC attribute. When applied to a parameter of an attribute, indicates that this parameter is an MVC action name.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.RazorSectionAttribute
member.summary: Razor attribute. Indicates that a parameter or a method is a Razor section. Use this attribute for custom wrappers similar to System.Web.WebPages.WebPageBase.RenderSection(String).

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.CollectionAccessAttribute
member.summary: Indicates how method, constructor invocation or property access over collection type affects content of the collection.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.None
member.summary: Method does not use or modify content of the collection.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.Read
member.summary: Method only reads content of the collection but does not modify it.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.ModifyExistingContent
member.summary: Method can change content of the collection but does not add new elements.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.CollectionAccessType.UpdatedContent
member.summary: Method can add new elements to the collection.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AssertionMethodAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method is assertion method, i.e. it halts control flow if one of the conditions is satisfied. To set the condition, mark one of the parameters with attribute.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AssertionConditionAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the condition parameter of the assertion method. The method itself should be marked by attribute. The mandatory argument of the attribute is the assertion type.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.AssertionConditionType
member.summary: Specifies assertion type. If the assertion method argument satisfies the condition, then the execution continues. Otherwise, execution is assumed to be halted.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_TRUE
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to true.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_FALSE
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to false.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_NULL
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to null value.

member.name: F:MaterialForms.Annotations.AssertionConditionType.IS_NOT_NULL
member.summary: Marked parameter should be evaluated to not null value.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.TerminatesProgramAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the marked method unconditionally terminates control flow execution. For example, it could unconditionally throw exception.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.LinqTunnelAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that method is pure LINQ method, with postponed enumeration (like Enumerable.Select, .Where). This annotation allows inference of [InstantHandle] annotation for parameters of delegate type by analyzing LINQ method chains.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.NoEnumerationAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that IEnumerable, passed as parameter, is not enumerated.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.RegexPatternAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that parameter is regular expression pattern.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.XamlItemsControlAttribute
member.summary: XAML attribute. Indicates the type that has ItemsSource property and should be treated as ItemsControl-derived type, to enable inner items DataContext type resolve.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.XamlItemBindingOfItemsControlAttribute
member.summary: XAML attribute. Indicates the property of some BindingBase-derived type, that is used to bind some item of ItemsControl-derived type. This annotation will enable the DataContext type resolve for XAML bindings for such properties.
member.remarks: Property should have the tree ancestor of the ItemsControl type or marked with the attribute.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Annotations.NoReorder
member.summary: Prevents the Member Reordering feature from tossing members of the marked class.
member.remarks: The attribute must be mentioned in your member reordering patterns

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialForm.FocusedSchema
member.summary: Gets or sets the value that indicates which form element should receive focus when the form is displayed. A negative value disables this feature.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialForm.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the schema with the specified key.

member.name: M:MaterialForms.MaterialForm.GetValuesDictionary
member.summary: Gets all form key-value pairs as a dictionary. Schemas that have no key or cannot hold values are excluded.

member.name: M:MaterialForms.MaterialForm.GetValuesDictionaryFromNames
member.summary: Gets all form name-value pairs as a dictionary. Schemas that have no name or cannot hold values are excluded.

member.name: M:MaterialForms.MaterialForm.GetValuesList
member.summary: Gets all form values as an indexed list. Schemas that cannot hold values are excluded.
member.remarks: Because some schemas cannot hold values, returned indexes may not match one to one with the form's.

member.name: M:MaterialForms.MaterialForm.GetValuesDynamic
member.summary: Gets all form key-value pairs as a dynamic object with keys as property names. Schemas that have no key or cannot hold values are excluded.

member.name: M:MaterialForms.MaterialForm.Bind``1
member.summary: Creates a new instance of specified type and tries to assign all matching form values to it. Schemas that have no keys or cannot hold values are excluded.
member.typeparam: Type of object to be assigned to. Must have a default constructor.

member.name: M:MaterialForms.MaterialForm.Bind``1(``0)
member.summary: Tries to assign all matching form values to an object of specified type. Schemas that have no keys or cannot hold values are excluded.
member.typeparam: Type of object to be assigned to.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.MaterialForm.View
member.summary: Gets a new view bound to the current state of the object. Use this if you need to host your forms manually.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.SchemaBase
member.summary: Base class for all schemas. Custom data types and controls can be implemented by extending this class.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.SchemaBase.Key
member.summary: Gets or sets the key that identifies the value in the form. Does not appear in the UI.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.SchemaBase.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name of the schema, usually appearing as a control hint or label.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.SchemaBase.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the schema, usually appearing as a tooltip on mouse over.

member.name: P:MaterialForms.SchemaBase.IconKind
member.summary: Gets or sets the icon type shown in the control. Some controls do not display icons.

member.name: T:MaterialForms.Tasks.TaskRunner
member.summary: Allows running background tasks while displaying a controllable progress dialog.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.
